content.title: Introduction to Stone Town Zanzibar
content.content: Stone Town is the historic heart of Zanzibar Island Tanzania, known for its rich cultural heritage, maze-like streets, and stunning Swahili architecture. As a UNESCO World Heritage Site, it reflects centuries of African, Arab, Indian, and European influences. If you're visiting Zanzibar, exploring Stone Town Zanzibar is an absolute must.

content.title: What to See in Stone Town Zanzibar

items.title: The House of Wonders (Beit-al-Ajaib) üèõÔ∏è
items.content: One of Zanzibar's most famous landmarks, the House of Wonders was once a sultan's palace and the first building in East Africa with electricity and an elevator. It offers a glimpse into Zanzibar's history and culture.

items.title: The Old Fort of Zanzibar (Ngome Kongwe) üè∞
items.content: Located near Forodhani Gardens, this 17th-century fort was built by the Omanis to defend Zanzibar from Portuguese attacks. Today, it hosts a marketplace, cultural performances, and festivals.

items.title: The Sultan's Palace Museum üèØ
items.content: A former royal residence, this museum showcases artifacts from Zanzibar's ruling families and tells the story of the Sultanate of Zanzibar.

items.title: The Anglican Cathedral & Former Slave Market ‚õ™
items.content: Zanzibar was a central hub in the East African slave trade. The cathedral stands on the site of the former slave market, with exhibits detailing Zanzibar's role in the abolition movement.

items.title: Forodhani Night Market üç¢
items.content: This lively food market along the waterfront is a must-visit in Stone Town Zanzibar. Try local delicacies like Zanzibar pizza, grilled seafood, and sugarcane juice.

content.title: Things to Do in Stone Town Zanzibar

items.title: Wander Through the Narrow Streets üèòÔ∏è
items.content: Lose yourself in Stone Town's winding alleys, filled with bustling markets, spice shops, and artisan stores selling handmade goods.

items.title: Visit The Rock Restaurant Zanzibar üçΩÔ∏è
items.content: Just a short trip from Stone Town, The Rock Restaurant Zanzibar is famous for its unique location on a rock in the Indian Ocean.

items.title: Explore Zanzibar's Historic Doors üö™
items.content: Stone Town is known for its intricately carved wooden doors, each telling a story about the status and history of its owners.

items.title: Take a Zanzibar Spice Tour üåø
items.content: Zanzibar is known as the Spice Island, and a spice farm tour from Stone Town allows you to see and taste cinnamon, cloves, vanilla, and nutmeg in their natural environment.
